gurmukhi: jwih shMsR PnI qn aUpir soie krI jl BIqr kRIVw ] jwih BBICn rwj dXo Aru jwih deI kup rwvn pIVw ]
transliteration: Jaah(i) Sahansraa Phanitan Oopar(i) Soe Karijal Bheetar Kreedaa|| Jaah(i) Bhabheechhan Raaj Dayo Ar(u) Jaah(i) Daikoup Raavan Peedaa||
translation: “He, who plays in the waters, being seated on Sheshanaga of thousands of heads; he, who in greatire, agonized Ravana and gave kingdom to Vibhishana;

gurmukhi: jwih dXo kr kY jg BIqr jIv crwcr Aau gj kIVw ] Kylq so biRj BUm ibKY ijn kIn surwsur bIc JgIVw ]398]
transliteration: Jaah(i) Dayo Kar Kai Jag Bheetar Jeev Chraachar Au Gad Keedaa|| Khelat So Brij Bhoom Bikhai Jin Keen Suraasur Beech Jhageedaa||398||
translation: “He, who mercifully gave life-breath to the movable and immovable beings and to the elephants and worms in the whole world; he is the same Lord, who is playing in Braja and who has ever seen the war between the gods and demons.398.

gurmukhi: bIr bfy durjoDn Awidk jw ihmrwie fry rn C`qRI ] jwih mrXo isspwl irsY kir rwjn mY kiRSnM br A`qRI ]
transliteration: Beer Bade Durjodhan Aadik Jaa Him-raae Dare Ran Chhattree|| Jaah(i) Daryo Sispaal Risai Kar(i) Raajan Mai Krishnan Bar Attree||
translation: “He, from whom, Duryodhana and other great warriors fear in the battlefield; he, who, in great rage, killed Shishupala, the same mighty hero is this Krishna;

gurmukhi: Kylq ho soaU gaUAn mY joaU hY jg ko krqw bD s`qRI ] Awg so DUsR lpytq ijau Pun gop khwvq hY ieh C`qRI ]399]
transliteration: Khelat Ho Sooo Gadoan Mai Jooo Hai Jag Ko Kartaa Badh Sattree|| Oog So Dhoomra Lapetat Jio Phoun Gop Kahaavat Hai Eh Chhattree||399||
translation: “The same Krishna is playing with his cows and the same Krishna is the killer of enemies and the creator of the whole world; and the same Krishna shines like a spark of fire amidst the smoke and calls himself a gopa, being a Kshatriya.399.

gurmukhi: kr ju`D mry iekly mD kItB rwj sq`kiRq kO ijh dIAw ] kuMBkrn mrXo ijn hY Aru rwvn ko iCn mY bD kIAw ]
transliteration: Kar Juddh Dare Ikle Madh Keetabh Raaj Satakkrit Kau Jih Deeaa|| Kounbhkaran Daryo Jin Hai At(u) Raavan Ko Chhin Mai Badh Keeaa||
translation: “Engaged in war with him, the demons Madhu and Kaitabh were killed and it was he, who gave kingdom toe Indra; Kumbhkarna also died, fighting with him and he killed Ravana in an instant;

gurmukhi: rwj BBICn pY kir AwnMd AauD clXo sMig lY kir sIAw ] pwpn ky bD kwrn sO Avqwr ibKY biRj kY Ab lIAw ]400]
transliteration: Raaj Bhabheechhan Pai Kar(i) Aanand Audh Chadyo San(i) Lai Kar(i) Seeaa|| Paapan Ke Badh Kaaran Sau Avtaar Bikhai Brij Kai Ab Leeaa||400||
translation: “It was he who after giving kingdom to Vibhishana and taking Sita with him, went towards Avadh and now he has incarnated in Braja in order to kill the sinners.”400.

gurmukhi: jO aupmw hir kI krI gopn qau pq gopn bwq khI hY ] jo ieh ko blu Awie khXo grgY hm so soaU bwq shI hY ]
transliteration: Jau Oupmaa Har(i) Kikarigopan Tau Pat Gopan Baat Kahihai|| Jo Eh Ko Bal(u) Aae Kahyo Gadgad Ham So Sooo Baat Sahihai||
translation: The way in which the gopas praised Krishna, in the same way, Nand, the Lord of gopas said, “The description, that you have given about the might of Krishna, is quite correct;

gurmukhi: pUqu khXo bsudyvih ko idj qwih imlXo Pun mwn iehI hY ] jo ieh ko Pun mwrn AwXo su qwhI kI dyh ghI n rhI hY ]401]
transliteration: Poot(u) Kahyo Basudevah(i) Ko Dij Taah(i) Milyo Phoun Maan Ihihai|| Jo Eh Ko Phoun Maaran Aayo Su Taahikideh Gadina Rahihai||401||
translation: “Purohit (the priest) has called him the son of Vasudev and this is his good fortune; he, who came to kill him, he himself was destroyed physically.”401.

gurmukhi: AQ ieMdR Awie drSn kIAw Aru bynqI krq BXw ]
transliteration: Ath Indra Aae Darshan Keeaa Ar(u) Bentikarat Bhayaa||
translation: Now begins the description of Indra’s coming to see Krishna and supplicate to him

gurmukhi: idn eyk gey bn ko hir jI mGvw qij mwn hrI pih AwXo ] pwpn ky bKSwvn kO hir ky qr pwien sIs invwXo ]
transliteration: Din Ek Gad Ban Ko Har(i) Jimaghva Taj(i) Maan Haripah(i) Aayo|| Paapan Ke Bakhshaavan Kau Har(i) Ke Ta Paain Sees Nivaayo||
translation: One day, when Krishna went to the forest, then casting away his pride, Indra came to him and bowed his head at the feet of Krishna for forgiveness of his sins;
